main_definition: To make or become safe from danger, loss, or injury; to ensure protection or stability.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To safeguard against theft or damage
meanings_and_examples.example: I always lock my door and windows to secure my house.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To ensure confidence, certainty, or reliability
meanings_and_examples.example: We need to secure our data by using strong passwords and encryption methods.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To support or stabilize an object or structure
meanings_and_examples.example: The pillars of the bridge were reinforced to secure its stability during earthquakes.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In finance, to guarantee payment on a loan or debt
meanings_and_examples.example: He offered his house as collateral to secure the bank loan for his business.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To hold something firmly in place
meanings_and_examples.example: Please make sure the jewelry is secure before you leave it on display.
